name: faithlessness
content:
faithlessness noun [U]
(NOT LOYAL)
Add to word list
Add to word list
the fact of not being sexually loyal to your marriage partner or usual sexual partner: While he may have his faults, faithlessness isn't one of them. She is cast in the role of the brilliant woman destroyed by her husband's faithlessness.
the quality of not being loyal or able to be trusted: He was angered by the treachery and faithlessness within the movement.
More examplesFewer examplesHis callous blend of macho faithlessness and jealousy continued.He displays extraordinary slyness and faithlessness.Faithlessness should be punished.

faithlessness noun [U]
(NOT RELIGIOUS)
the state of having no religious faith: The present era is notable for unbelief and faithlessness. She was an atheist shocked by the faithlessness of the believers.
More examplesFewer examplesThe message of the letter is that faithlessness in the church is to be expected.People abandon immorality for morality and substitute faithlessness for faith and selfishness for generosity.
